snippet: The increase was a result of an extended effort to recruit minorities and women to take an updated exam, after a judge ruled that the last test, given in 2007, was discriminatory.
lead_paragraph: For the past two years, Fire Department recruiters have complied aggressively with a court-mandated effort to diversify the department by increasing the number of minority applicants. Their efforts seem to have paid off. Of the 42,161 applicants who took the firefighter exam this spring, 19,260 were nonwhite and 1,952 were women -- both all-time highs for groups traditionally underrepresented in the department, the fire commissioner, Salvatore J. Cassano, said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Fire Dept. Doubles Minority and Female Applicants
